content.title: RHSA-2022:8940: kernel security and bug fix update (Important)
content.description:
The kernel packages contain the Linux kernel, the core of any Linux operating system.

Security Fix(es):

* kernel: KVM: cmpxchg_gpte can write to pfns outside the userspace region (CVE-2022-1158)

* kernel: openvswitch: integer underflow leads to out-of-bounds write in reserve_sfa_size() (CVE-2022-2639)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* s390x: bpftrace Could not read symbols from /sys/kernel/debug/tracing/available_filter_functions: No such device (BZ#2134808)
